items.name: Algorithmic Art
items.description: To begin, create an ALGORITHMIC PHILOSOPHY (not static images or templates) that will be interpreted through: - Computational processes, emergent behavior, mathematical beauty - Seeded randomness, noise fields, organic systems

items.name: Brand Guidelines
items.description: To access Anthropic's official brand identity and style resources, use this skill.

items.name: Canvas Design
items.description: To begin, create a VISUAL PHILOSOPHY (not layouts or templates) that will be interpreted through: - Form, space, color, composition - Images, graphics, shapes, patterns - Minimal text as visual accent

items.name: Doc Coauthoring
items.description: This skill provides a structured workflow for guiding users through collaborative document creation. Act as an active guide, walking users through three stages: Context Gathering, Refinement & Structure, and Reader Testing.

items.name: Docx
items.description: A user may ask you to create, edit, or analyze the contents of a .docx file. A .docx file is essentially a ZIP archive containing XML files and other resources that you can read or edit. You have different tools and workflows available for different tasks.

items.name: Frontend Design
items.description: Before coding, understand the context and commit to a BOLD aesthetic direction: - **Purpose**: What problem does this interface solve? Who uses it? - **Tone**: Pick an extreme: brutally minimal, maximalist chaos, retro-futuristic, organic/natural, luxury/refined, playful/toy-like, editorial/magazine, brutalist/raw, art deco/geometric, soft/pastel, industrial/utilitarian, etc. There are so many flavors to choose from. Use these for inspiration but design one that is true to the aesthetic directio

items.name: Internal Comms
items.description: To write internal communications, use this skill for: - 3P updates (Progress, Plans, Problems) - Company newsletters - FAQ responses - Status reports - Leadership updates - Project updates - Incident reports

items.name: Mcp Builder
items.description: Create MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers that enable LLMs to interact with external services through well-designed tools. The quality of an MCP server is measured by how well it enables LLMs to accomplish real-world tasks.

items.name: Pdf
items.description: This guide covers essential PDF processing operations using Python libraries and command-line tools. For advanced features, JavaScript libraries, and detailed examples, see reference.md. If you need to fill out a PDF form, read forms.md and follow its instructions.

items.name: Pptx
items.description: A user may ask you to create, edit, or analyze the contents of a .pptx file. A .pptx file is essentially a ZIP archive containing XML files and other resources that you can read or edit. You have different tools and workflows available for different tasks.

items.name: Skill Creator
items.description: This skill provides guidance for creating effective skills.

items.name: Slack Gif Creator
items.description: A toolkit providing utilities and knowledge for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack.

items.name: Theme Factory
items.description: This skill provides a curated collection of professional font and color themes themes, each with carefully selected color palettes and font pairings. Once a theme is chosen, it can be applied to any artifact.

items.name: Web Artifacts Builder
items.description: To build powerful frontend claude.ai artifacts, follow these steps: 1. Initialize the frontend repo using `scripts/init-artifact.sh` 2. Develop your artifact by editing the generated code 3. Bundle all code into a single HTML file using `scripts/bundle-artifact.sh`

items.name: Webapp Testing
items.description: To test local web applications, write native Python Playwright scripts.

items.name: Xlsx
items.description: - Every Excel model MUST be delivered with ZERO formula errors (#REF!, #DIV/0!, #VALUE!, #N/A, #NAME?)

items.name: Atlas
items.description: Use the bundled CLI to control Atlas and inspect local browser data.

items.name: Cloudflare Deploy
items.description: Consolidated skill for building on the Cloudflare platform. Use decision trees below to find the right product, then load detailed references.

items.name: Develop Web Game
items.description: Build games in small steps and validate every change. Treat each iteration as: implement → act → pause → observe → adjust.

items.name: Doc
items.description: - Read or review DOCX content where layout matters (tables, diagrams, pagination). - Create or edit DOCX files with professional formatting. - Validate visual layout before delivery.

items.name: Figma Implement Design
items.description: This skill provides a structured workflow for translating Figma designs into production-ready code with pixel-perfect accuracy. It ensures consistent integration with the Figma MCP server, proper use of design tokens, and 1:1 visual parity with designs.

items.name: Gh Address Comments
items.description: Guide to find the open PR for the current branch and address its comments with gh CLI. Run all `gh` commands with elevated network access.

items.name: Gh Fix Ci
items.description: Use gh to locate failing PR checks, fetch GitHub Actions logs for actionable failures, summarize the failure snippet, then propose a fix plan and implement after explicit approval. - If a plan-oriented skill (for example `create-plan`) is available, use it; otherwise draft a concise plan inline and request approval before implementing.

items.name: Imagegen
items.description: Generates or edits images for the current project (e.g., website assets, game assets, UI mockups, product mockups, wireframes, logo design, photorealistic images, infographics). Defaults to `gpt-image-1.5` and the OpenAI Image API, and prefers the bundled CLI for deterministic, reproducible runs.

items.name: Jupyter Notebook
items.description: Create clean, reproducible Jupyter notebooks for two primary modes:

items.name: Linear
items.description: This skill provides a structured workflow for managing issues, projects & team workflows in Linear. It ensures consistent integration with the Linear MCP server, which offers natural-language project management for issues, projects, documentation, and team collaboration.

items.name: Netlify Deploy
items.description: Deploy web projects to Netlify using the Netlify CLI with intelligent detection of project configuration and deployment context.

items.name: Notion Knowledge Capture
items.description: Convert conversations and notes into structured, linkable Notion pages for easy reuse.

items.name: Notion Meeting Intelligence
items.description: Prep meetings by pulling Notion context, tailoring agendas/pre-reads, and enriching with Codex research.

items.name: Notion Research Documentation
items.description: Pull relevant Notion pages, synthesize findings, and publish clear briefs or reports (with citations and links to sources).

items.name: Notion Spec To Implementation
items.description: Convert a Notion spec into linked implementation plans, tasks, and ongoing status updates.

items.name: Openai Docs
items.description: Provide authoritative, current guidance from OpenAI developer docs using the developers.openai.com MCP server. Always prioritize the developer docs MCP tools over web.run for OpenAI-related questions. Only if the MCP server is installed and returns no meaningful results should you fall back to web search.

items.name: Pdf
items.description: - Read or review PDF content where layout and visuals matter. - Create PDFs programmatically with reliable formatting. - Validate final rendering before delivery.

items.name: Playwright
items.description: Drive a real browser from the terminal using `playwright-cli`. Prefer the bundled wrapper script so the CLI works even when it is not globally installed. Treat this skill as CLI-first automation. Do not pivot to `@playwright/test` unless the user explicitly asks for test files.

items.name: Render Deploy
items.description: Render supports **Git-backed** services and **prebuilt Docker image** services.

items.name: Screenshot
items.description: Follow these save-location rules every time:

items.name: Sentry
items.description: - If not already authenticated, ask the user to provide a valid `SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN` (read-only scopes such as `project:read`, `event:read`) or to log in and create one before running commands. - Set `SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN` as an env var.

items.name: Sora
items.description: Creates or manages short video clips for the current project (product demos, marketing spots, cinematic shots, UI mocks). Defaults to `sora-2` and a structured prompt augmentation workflow, and prefers the bundled CLI for deterministic runs. Note: `$sora` is a skill tag in prompts, not a shell command.

items.name: Speech
items.description: Generate spoken audio for the current project (narration, product demo voiceover, IVR prompts, accessibility reads). Defaults to `gpt-4o-mini-tts-2025-12-15` and built-in voices, and prefers the bundled CLI for deterministic, reproducible runs.

items.name: Spreadsheet
items.description: - Build new workbooks with formulas, formatting, and structured layouts. - Read or analyze tabular data (filter, aggregate, pivot, compute metrics). - Modify existing workbooks without breaking formulas or references.

items.name: Transcribe
items.description: Transcribe audio using OpenAI, with optional speaker diarization when requested. Prefer the bundled CLI for deterministic, repeatable runs.

items.name: Vercel Deploy
items.description: Deploy any project to Vercel instantly. No authentication required.

items.name: Yeet
items.description: - Require GitHub CLI `gh`. Check `gh --version`. If missing, ask the user to install `gh` and stop. - Require authenticated `gh` session. Run `gh auth status`. If not authenticated, ask the user to run `gh auth login` (and re-run `gh auth status`) before continuing.

items.name: Codex Readiness Integration Test
items.description: This skill runs a multi-stage integration test to validate agentic execution quality. It always runs in execute mode (no read-only mode).

items.name: Codex Readiness Unit Test
items.description: Instruction-first, in-session "readiness" for evaluating AGENTS/PLANS documentation quality without any external APIs or SDKs. All checks run against the current working directory (cwd), with no monorepo discovery. Each run writes to `.codex-readiness-unit-test/<timestamp>/` and updates `.codex-readiness-unit-test/latest.json`. Keep execution deterministic (filesystem scanning + local command execution only). All LLM evaluation happens in-session and must output strict JSON via the provided refe

items.name: Create Plan
items.description: Turn a user prompt into a **single, actionable plan** delivered in the final assistant message.

items.name: Gitlab Address Comments
items.description: Find the open MR for the current branch and address its review threads using `glab`. Run all `glab` commands with elevated network access.

items.name: Brainstorming
items.description: Help turn ideas into fully formed designs and specs through natural collaborative dialogue.

items.name: Dispatching Parallel Agents
items.description: When you have multiple unrelated failures (different test files, different subsystems, different bugs), investigating them sequentially wastes time. Each investigation is independent and can happen in parallel.

items.name: Executing Plans
items.description: Load plan, review critically, execute tasks in batches, report for review between batches.

items.name: Finishing A Development Branch
items.description: Guide completion of development work by presenting clear options and handling chosen workflow.

items.name: Receiving Code Review
items.description: Code review requires technical evaluation, not emotional performance.

items.name: Requesting Code Review
items.description: Dispatch superpowers:code-reviewer subagent to catch issues before they cascade.

items.name: Subagent Driven Development
items.description: Execute plan by dispatching fresh subagent per task, with two-stage review after each: spec compliance review first, then code quality review.

items.name: Systematic Debugging
items.description: Random fixes waste time and create new bugs. Quick patches mask underlying issues.

items.name: Test Driven Development
items.description: Write the test first. Watch it fail. Write minimal code to pass.

items.name: Using Git Worktrees
items.description: Git worktrees create isolated workspaces sharing the same repository, allowing work on multiple branches simultaneously without switching.

items.name: Using Superpowers
items.description: **In Claude Code:** Use the `Skill` tool. When you invoke a skill, its content is loaded and presented to you—follow it directly. Never use the Read tool on skill files.

items.name: Verification Before Completion
items.description: Claiming work is complete without verification is dishonesty, not efficiency.

items.name: Writing Plans
items.description: Write comprehensive implementation plans assuming the engineer has zero context for our codebase and questionable taste. Document everything they need to know: which files to touch for each task, code, testing, docs they might need to check, how to test it. Give them the whole plan as bite-sized tasks. DRY. YAGNI. TDD. Frequent commits.

items.name: Writing Skills
items.description: **Writing skills IS Test-Driven Development applied to process documentation.**

items.name: Supabase Postgres Best Practices
items.description: Comprehensive performance optimization guide for Postgres, maintained by Supabase. Contains rules across 8 categories, prioritized by impact to guide automated query optimization and schema design.

items.name: Playwright Skill
items.description: General-purpose browser automation skill. I'll write custom Playwright code for any automation task you request and execute it via the universal executor.

items.name: Skills
items.description: Skills are folders of instructions, scripts, and resources that Claude loads dynamically to improve performance on specialized tasks. Skills teach Claude how to complete specific tasks in a repeatable way, whether that's creating documents with your company's brand guidelines, analyzing data using your organization's specific workflows, or automating personal tasks.

items.name: NanoBanana PPT Skills

items.name: Frontend Slides
items.description: Create zero-dependency, animation-rich HTML presentations that run entirely in the browser. This skill helps non-designers discover their preferred aesthetic through visual exploration ("show, don't tell"), then generates production-quality slide decks.

items.name: Superpowers

items.name: Pypict Claude Skill
items.description: This skill enables systematic test case design using PICT (Pairwise Independent Combinatorial Testing). Given requirements or code, it analyzes the system to identify test parameters, generates a PICT model with appropriate constraints, executes the model to generate pairwise test cases, and formats the results with expected outputs.
